timeline.title: Graduated High School
timeline.description: Graduated high school with the highest score among peers.

timeline.title: Passed EIT
timeline.description: Passed EIT (External independent evaluation) - the main examination for admission to universities in Ukraine with the high scores 195/200 for Math and 190/200 for English.

timeline.title: Bachelor of Computer Science
timeline.description: Was admitted to one of the most prestigious and oldest universities in Ukraine. Pursued a comprehensive Computer Science program with a focus on learning algorithms and data structures, programming, databases, and other key areas.

timeline.title: Worked as Math & IT tutor
timeline.description: Worked as a Math and IT tutor for children aged 7–16. Developed individualised study programs, aligning with the school curriculum, to help students overcome their unique learning challenges and reach their academic goals. Mentored my oldest student, who was 17 years old, to prepare for and successfully pass critical exams after school. This achievement paved the way for their admission to the top university.

timeline.title: Moved to Australia due to the war in Ukraine
timeline.description: Took academic leave in my Ukrainian university and relocated to the Sunshine Coast, Australia.

timeline.title: Nabooki
timeline.description:
Worked as a Junior Developer / Trainee at Nabooki, an Australian company specialising in booking system and marketplace technology.
I assisted the development team in enhancing platform functionality, primarily focusing on front-end UI updates (React) for the marketplace.
I also supported the QA team during regression testing and assisted the Customer Support team with resolving user queries. Additionally, I helped maintain the marketing website built in WordPress.
This valuable experience deepened my understanding of real-world development workflows and team dynamics.

timeline.title: Bachelor of ICT
timeline.description:
Pursued Bachelor of ICT at UniSC. Received and maintained a scholarship throughout the entire program by consistently achieving high grades.
Took classes from various fields across IT, such as database management, systems design, network administration, cybersecurity, but focused mainly on software development.

I actively engaged in collaborative projects and gained a lot of practical experience through industry-relevant assignments.
I enjoyed going to the university's social sports (volleyball, badminton) and participating in students' organisations, such as Student Guild.
My GPA: 6.5/7

timeline.title: Housekeeper at Sea Pearl Mooloolaba and Landmark Resort & Spa
timeline.description:
Worked as a housekeeper at two prominent resorts: Sea Pearl Mooloolaba, a luxury beachfront hotel, and Landmark Resort & Spa, a busy and popular resort. Delivered high-quality room servicing, showed initiative and professionalism, and received positive feedback from management. These roles strengthened my time management, organisation, and communication skills, while helping me stay focused and reliable in a fast-paced environment.
I balanced this work alongside my university studies.

timeline.title: Keep learning programming on my own
timeline.description: When I began studying computer science at the university I quickly realised that developer's career can be described as journey of continuous learning. The institution alone would not give me enough knowledge and skills to become proficient in software development, therefore I dedicate a lot of time and effort to self-study. I keep honing my programming skills, exploring new technologies and frameworks, and applying this knowledge to interesting projects to enrich my portfolio.
